subject: BIOL
title: Systems Neuroscience: From Neurons to Behaviour
description: Systems neuroscience attempts to explain complex functions of the nervous system in terms of underlying neural circuits. The course focuses on how neural circuits analyze sensory information, form perceptions, make decisions, and execute movements, as well as contribute to high-level mental functions such as language, memory, and self-awareness. [Note: BIOL 376 is recommended. Offered: F]
